subject: Critical Thinking
title: SIFT Method: A Quick Source Evaluation Framework
description: A fast breakdown of SIFT Method: A Quick Source Evaluation Framework for builders.

hook.text: You see a shocking claim online. In 30 seconds, you can determine if it's worth your attention.

buildup.text: SIFT: Stop, Investigate the source, Find better coverage, Trace the original claim. Four steps, 30 seconds.

discovery.text: Mike Caulfield developed SIFT for digital literacy. It's used by universities and fact-checkers worldwide.

twist.text: The crucial step is STOP. Most people react first and think later. The pause before sharing is the most valuable second.

climax.text: Finding better coverage means: search for the same claim in trusted sources.

punchline.text: Stop. Investigate. Find. Trace. Thirty seconds to separate signal from noise.

quiz.question: What does the 'S' in SIFT stand for?
